events.originalText: Sembawang Hot Spring Park in Singapore reopened after being redeveloped by the National Parks Board.
events.subtitle: Sembawang Hot Spring Park
events.headline: Sembawang Hot Spring Park Reopens in Singapore

events.originalText: A passenger train collided with a truck and derailed in the Free State, South Africa, killing 21 people and injuring 254 others.
events.subtitle: Hennenmanâ€“Kroonstad train crash
events.headline: Tragic Train Collision in Free State, South Africa: 21 Dead, 254 Injured

events.originalText: The Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest structure, officially opened in Dubai.
events.subtitle: Burj Khalifa
events.headline: Burj Khalifa Officially Opens in Dubai

events.originalText: Nancy Pelosi became Speaker of the United States House of Representatives, becoming the highest-ranking woman in the history of the U.S. government.
events.subtitle: Nancy Pelosi
events.headline: Nancy Pelosi Becomes Speaker of the United States House of Representatives

events.originalText: Spirit (artist's impression depicted), the first of two rovers of NASA's Mars Exploration Rover mission, successfully landed on Mars.
events.subtitle: Spirit (rover)
events.headline: NASA's Spirit Rover Successfully Lands on Mars

events.originalText: Two American F-14 Tomcats shot down two Libyan MiG-23 Floggers that appeared to be attempting to engage them over the Gulf of Sidra.
events.subtitle: Grumman F-14 Tomcat
events.headline: American F-14 Tomcats Shoot Down Libyan MiG-23 Floggers

events.originalText: The English punk-rock band Sex Pistols lewd and disruptive behaviour at Heathrow Airport prompts the record label EMI to end their contract with them
events.subtitle: Punk rock
events.headline: Sex Pistols' Disruptive Behaviour Leads to Contract Termination

events.originalText: Last of the Summer Wine, the longest-running sitcom in the world, premiered as an episode of the BBC's Comedy Playhouse.
events.subtitle: Last of the Summer Wine
events.headline: Longest-Running Sitcom 'Last of the Summer Wine' Premieres

events.originalText: Rose Heilbron (pictured) became the first female judge to sit at the Central Criminal Court of England and Wales.
events.subtitle: Rose Heilbron
events.headline: Rose Heilbron Becomes First Female Judge at Central Criminal Court of England and Wales

events.originalText: Korean War: Chinese and North Korean troops captured Seoul from United Nations forces.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: Chinese and North Korean Troops Capture Seoul in Korean War

events.originalText: Billboard published its first music hit parade.
events.subtitle: Billboard (magazine)
events.headline: Billboard Publishes First Music Hit Parade

events.originalText: British explorer Aeneas Mackintosh (pictured), a member of the Nimrod Expedition, escaped death by fleeing across ice floes.
events.subtitle: Aeneas Mackintosh
events.headline: British Explorer Aeneas Mackintosh Escapes Death on Nimrod Expedition

events.originalText: Solomon Northup regained his freedom after having been sold into slavery in the American South; his memoir Twelve Years a Slave later became a bestseller.
events.subtitle: Solomon Northup
events.headline: Solomon Northup Regains Freedom from Slavery in American South

events.originalText: After his appointment as Prince of Wallachia, Constantine Hangerli arrived in Bucharest to assume the throne.
events.subtitle: List of princes of Wallachia
events.headline: Constantine Hangerli Arrives in Bucharest as Prince of Wallachia

events.originalText: Most of London's Palace of Whitehall, the main residence of English monarchs since 1530, was destroyed by fire.
events.subtitle: Palace of Whitehall
events.headline: London's Palace of Whitehall Destroyed by Fire
